data.formatted_address: China, Shan Dong Sheng, Qing Dao Shi, Shi Bei Qu, Deng Zhou Lu, 56号-1 邮政编码: 266022
data.name: Tsingtao Brewery Museum

reviews.text:
Nice tour of the famous Tsingtao Brewery. This is "Factory #1", which apparently opened in 1903 by German immigrants. The tour takes you thru several buildings showing the original equipment and also the modern, automated parts. There is a nice museum store, a tasting room and lastly a pub serving various types of Tsingtao beer. Never knew they had their own IPA, Stout, Hefeweissen, etc.
Note: if you are a foreigner, you will need a passport to purchase tickets!
Very good experience having tour here, the production and the museum that enable me to taste the original qingdao beer. Super tasty.

Tsingtao beer factory is cool, they go through the whole history. If you come to this city this is one of the place that you need to visit.
Price is not expensive.
Exit A MRT Taidong turn left to time walk along Dengzhou road. On the right-hand, pass through Tsingtao museum bar and Tsingtao master puffy Bakery shop 150 metres to arrive this museum.

Australian travellers - Outstanding brewery with so much history. We did the private tour with an English speaking guide & she was excellent! $50AUD each for private tour, beer paddle, bread from their own bakery, nuts, more beer & a personalised beer sticker with your photo is put on a bottle and presented in a cute box! Oh & more beer! Not just your average brewery tour. A highlight of our time in Qingdao!

reviews.text: Impressive building with great views on the sea. The entrance fee is only 8.5rmb, and it's really worth it to get in and walk around. If you'd have to decide, this or the Princess House, pick this one!
A beautiful historical building. In Japan, similar buildings exist at Yamate area in Yokohama. They were built by foreigners about 100  years ago. This Huashi Building might have the similar history.
It’s the place you should come as it’s an iconic place you when you come to qingdao

Built in 1932, Huashi Lou (花石楼) combines Greek, Gothic, and Gothic influences throughout its five storey hulk. It is constructed from marble and stone and features a large turret and a multicolored outer face which inspired the locals' nickname for the structure, "the colorful rock building".It also contains a passageway which Chiang Kai-shek used to get from the building to the seashore.

the surrounding is beautiful, the sea with lovely greenery. but the building is old and kitsch with horrible looking garden sculptures. inside is even worse. poorly maintained furniture and all explanatory notes are in chinese. considering how important this place is - occupants are Chiang KS and soong sister, they could have done better

reviews.text: If you are a beer lover, you are going to want to read this. The building at the end of the pier is the building printed on the label of the Qingdao beer bottles (or so I am told). I will post some pictures of when I visited and hope the place is as beautiful and cool for you as it was for my group and I.

The place is pretty popular with local tourists and the Prince Hotel nearby is suppose to serve a good breakfasts for its guests as well as other dining options.

I've visited the place in Jan/Feb 2017. It's a low season here this time of the year, but there were a lot of people on the pier, especially during the day. I personally enjoyed it more in the evening, as you can enjoy the night view of the city coast.
It nice to have a short stay over Zhan Qiao - so long if you are a natural lover .

Absolutely gorgeous. Very busy, lots of people, but I had a lucky day in terms of weather and it was absolutely worth it. If you come to Qingdao, visiting this place for a nice walk in the sun is absolutely mandatory.

data.formatted_address: China, Shan Dong Sheng, Qing Dao Shi, Shi Nan Qu, 沂水路11号 邮政编码: 266005
data.name: 胶澳总督府

reviews.text: Interesting church architecture. Favorite part was the clock in the tower which was operational along with the bells.

In 1995 it was classified as a key cultural relic and placed under state-level protection. This historical building is still used by the Qingdao People’s Municipal Government and is not open to the general public or tourists.  Head east on YiShui Road (沂水路) for more historical attractions.
Impressive looking building though not that amazing.

An official residence located in Qingdao, Shandong Province, combines the typical style of the German Wilhelm era and the design style of Jugendstil. It has yellow walls and a red roof. It is famous for its non-contrasting architectural style. It houses rare antique pianos produced in Germany, German-made furniture, and finely carved furniture from the Qing Dynasty. The courtyard is full of lush trees and green grass, creating a European pastoral style.

At first glance, the thick-browed boy felt that the Governor's Palace was like a castle in a fairy tale.
It's a pity that photography is not allowed indoors. All I can say is that all the decorations, furniture and furnishings are extremely well maintained, almost 100% restoring the grandeur of the past.
The fireplaces here are very special. Each fireplace has a completely different style and can be appreciated as a work of art.
The most valuable cultural relic is a German grand piano that is more than a hundred years old. It is said that there are only two identical pianos left in the world.
It is unknown whether it is because many CCP leaders, including Mao Zedong, once lived here and escaped disaster during the Cultural Revolution and were not destroyed by the Red Guards...
There is actually a third floor of the Jiao'ao Governor's Palace, but that is where offices are located, and "state secrets" may be hidden there, so the public is not allowed to visit.
There is a large fort next to the cliff, which of course was left by the Germans.
There is also a machine gun in the fort. Are these also antiques?

data.formatted_address: Shinan District, Qingdao, China, 266005
data.name: Old Observatory Youth Hostel Qingdao

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in November 2014 taking a break from Beijing before a Trans-Siberian trip back to the UK. Its in an old observatory so you can imagine the location (hilltop) and the general ambience is nice. Great friendly staff on the reception and in the restaurant, comfortable rooms, mine was south facing to the woods with the sun shining in the window in the early morning. The whole atmosphere of the hostel is quiet, relaxing and pleasant. Food is excellent and good value. I recommend the German muesli breakfast which I've tried to replicate back home but can't -food just tastes better when you are travelling!  The restaurant is great for having a quiet beer in the evening and you can go out onto the rooftop garden. One of the best places I've stayed in.

Had one hell of a time finding this place but man was it worth it!  We were looking for a chill place to have dinner and we're referred by a friend.  After about an hour of walking down dark streets and alleyways, asking random Chinese folks for directions (all pointing different directions) and finally walking up some spooking looking spiral staircase where a bear of a dog tried to eat us, we finally arrived.
We were greeted with a warmly lit, open air café and bar overlooking the city.  The staff were very friendly and spoke understandable English.  They were even playing American country music!  The ambiance was topped with the smell of our All-day-breakfast order of hashbrowns, German sausage, toast and fruit juice.
I highly recommend this place as a restaurant, café and bar.  Although I haven't stayed in the hostel, I can only imagine how great it would be.
Stayed here for a week at the end of a trip to beijing.  I had a great time exploring the city with other travelers I met at the hostel.

reviews.author_name: 張仁洋ちょう じん よう
reviews.text: The environment is good, and the two dogs and one cat raised by the youth hostel are so cute! Then there is a cafe on the top floor. If your itinerary is more casual, you can go and enjoy brunch. It is very comfortable~
Located on the top of the mountain, the view is very good and the atmosphere of the youth hostel is also very good. It takes a while to go up and down the mountain each time.

data.formatted_address: 2 Lai Yang Lu, Shi Nan Qu, Qing Dao Shi, Shan Dong Sheng, China, 266005
data.name: Qingdao Aquarium

reviews.text: Place is large, lots of different animals on display, and clearly very popular with families. Far too many animals in enclosures that are too small for them. About the only animals that seemed well cared for were the penguins. Overall quite a sad experience.

In the year 2017, I visited underwater aquarium in Qingdao. Before this I never visited any aquarium, so it was a fascinating experience for me.

it is situated  in Qingdao, Shandong Province.  Qingdao Aquarium it is situated on Huiquan Bay in Qingdao, Shandong Province. Qingdao Underwater World consists of several interesting galleries including the inter-tidal zones, underwater tunnel, performance hall and exhibition areas.

The inter-tidal zones has Various algae, echinoderms, marine mollusks, arthropods and small amounts of fish are living here. Common marine life like starfish, sea urchins, sea turtles, octopus, crabs and small sharks can be seen; some bright-colored or odd-shaped varieties will  give you a spectacular view.

Underwater tunnel

The underwater tunnel breeds thousands of kinds of halo bios he,m some rare species. In the tunnel, you can see sharks.

Specimen hall

The magnificent main building followed the Chinese traditional fortress, and was reputed as one of the ten most imposing buildings of Qingdao City. Preserved bodies of Sea beasts like harbor seals, South American sea lions, Humboldt penguins are also kept.

Fresh water fish center

The Freshwater Fish Center  exhibits many rare and endangered species and some tropical fish, including South American arapaima, precious angelfish, Chinese sturgeons, Yangtze alligators and giant salamanders. In addition, there is a special exhibition area for the jellyfish.

A lot of wooden models of animals in lieu of real animals, but the real jellyfish, turtles, and the sharks and stingrays in the underwater portion, they were all nice. It's ok. It's worth a visit if only for its beautiful location in a gorgeous park by the water with a beautiful view of the ocean and beach. Purely as an aquarium it's the worst aquarium I've ever visited and would get two stars, but given it's location, I bumped it up a star. There are better things to do in the city, but if you're into this kind of thing or have kids with you, why not have a visit.

What can I say...but it was better than what I had expected. I was able to find out there are numerous types of Qingdao beer. After the tour of the museum, I was able to differentiate between the beer from factory 1 and factory 2.. a big progress. Qingdao beer seems to show the character of the Qingdao citizens..mild and pleasant.

This isn't the best aquarium that I've visited but if you're in Qingdao. . . take a little while to stop on by and visit it. On very busy days you might feel like a minnow in the middle of huge school of fish. . . so I would try to go on a weekday.

reviews.text: Prefer to visit at night

The building in the famous Tsingtao Beer is the Huiran Pavilion. When you visit Qingdao, one place you will definitely pass by or visit at least a few times is Zhanqiao. You can see this famous building if you go to the end of the pier. If you go on a holiday or during peak season, it is not easy to come across Hoerangak. First of all, the length of the pier is 440m. The round trip is over 800m. Plus, there are so many people. Because it has strong symbolism, many people want to take pictures here to commemorate their visit to Qingdao. Hoerangak itself is just a small two-story pavilion, but the surrounding scenery from here is spectacular. The wide sea, swimming beach, and forest of towering buildings come together to create a great backdrop for photos. However, you may not be able to get to Hoerangak due to the huge crowd, which may increase your discomfort level. Going up to the second floor is also a challenge. If there are a lot of people, I think it is good for your mental health to take pictures from a distance and quickly move to a nearby tourist attraction.

The corridor is located at the end of the pier, and it was disappointing that access to the second floor was restricted when I visited. The first floor has photos on display, in Chinese and English.
You can walk to Pichai Yuen by exiting the corridor, passing the pier, going out onto the road, and going straight. If you follow the road to the right, you will see the Empress Hall on your left. Not bad for a quick stop.
If you leave the Empress Hall and turn left, you will find the German Prison Museum, which is temporarily closed until March 31. If you go further along the way, there is Aqua World and many other places to see, but I couldn't go due to time constraints.
The recommended course is to start from Pichaiyuan, visit the cathedral before going to Jangyo, stop by Jangyo, go to the Empress Hall, German Prison Museum, and Aqua World. This is a course that can be walked.

The location is near Qingdao Station, close to the business and hotel areas. It is very convenient, the scenery is beautiful, and there are many people. Watching the sunset is beautiful and it is free.

There are a few places within Laoshan that you will not be able to photograph due to religious beliefs (which is completely understandable) but trust me, you can fill you SD card with everything else you see and photograph. Do yourself a favor and do not overlook this gem of a destination during your next visit to China.

reviews.text: The church is located in a big square, and is very beautiful, it’s one of the biggest symbols of the German colonization, around the church there is many pedestrian streets and looks like you are in Europe, I liked the place, I was here in the new lunar year time, than in front the church and in the streets around it was many crowded with many attractions like a parade with dragons and people dancing, was beautiful.

https://maps.app.goo.gl/z1h2anLF7fbhRB8j7
It’s not really church but also not a historical building as everything was redone after cultural revolution. Not worth 10 RMB in my view.
One of the most beautiful and iconic place you should come

Worth paying a visit if you find yourself in the old town part of Qingdao, even if only to look at it from the outside. Entry is ticketed (10rmb) and a reservation can be made via the Qingdao tourist attraction mini Wechat app. Do check on the opening hours as the church is an active one which is still in service.

It is a popular destination for couples taking themed wedding photos. The inside of the church is well maintained, though it is unclear whether the stained glass windows are originals. The church has been badly damaged during the Cultural Revolution and was later restored and reopened for religious worship in 1981. The church was built in the early 1930s by the German missionaries. Our local friend told us that it was rumoured that the original plan was for the church to be 100m tall but construction plans changed abruptly in 1934 after Hitler came to power and prohibited the transfer of money overseas.

The inside compound is small, and has a little store selling Chinese language bibles and other items such as rosaries and other accessories.

reviews.text: It’s a zoo, have a good variety of animals, they have a place to children to play (a small park), the biggest attraction is the two giant pandas, but som parts of the zoo are sad, because you see some animals in small places, when I went many tropical animals enclosure like the macaws, black panther, panther was empty, I don’t know if the animals were dead or were taken to another place because of the low temperature (there was a snow in the week before and the temperatures were below zero). But I liked to see the pandas (giant and red).

If there was a minus star I'd give it a minus. If you like animals don't go there. Really small enclosures, too many animals in them, some look malnutritioned, and with body wounds. Petting zoo isn't petting at all, and thankfully so, as chinese shout at animals and would probably try to pull rabbits etc from each other. There is ONE panda and paces around very restlessly even though she should only be active in the morning.

* Qingdao Forest Wildlife World is located on the Lingzhu Mountain side of Little Pearl Mountain (Xiao Zhushan) Scenic Area, Huangdao District, Qingdao.

* The zoo is quite nice for China, located on the side of a mountain with a fair amount of space for the animals. It is quite a large park and lots of activities/events you can watch so plan for a full day there.

* Qingdao Forest Wildlife World zoo is a large comprehensive theme park integrating wildlife display and protection, popularization of science, catering, leisure and entertainment into a whole. The animals develop live in an ecological environment with green mountains, clear water, fresh air environment. A sightseeing bridges zigzags in the valley, passes through jungles and wanders over the beast area.

————————
1. Off-season price (November 1 — the following year on March 31): 70RMB;
2. High season price (April 1 – October 31st): 100RMB;
3. Discount ticket: 50RMB.
4. Opening time is 9:00am – 5:00pm. Ticket fare is RMB45.
————————

Little Pearl Mountain Wildlife Park Zoo officially called (Qingdao Forrest Wildlife World) is a national 4 A level tourism scenic area. It’s located on the west side of Qingdao’s Kaifaqu (Economic and Technological Development Zone). In December of 2000, the Chinese State Forestry Administration set up here. In 2004, the Chinese Tourism Bureau readjusted its overall plan for Little Pearl Mountain Wildlife Park Zoo adjusting the area to 4079.64 hectares.

🐼 🐼 🐼
Thanks For Watching 🙂!

On a sunny, clear sky day it would be nice, however on a foggy/cloudy day it is not worth anything to us.

reviews.text: For me it’s the best attraction in Qingdao, the museum is free (need make reservation by WeChat and one people of the group need have a Chinese sim card, because it’s required to get the SMS code), I did my reservation two days before the visit, there is no charge, the queue to visit was very big because of the security check, the museum don’t is accessible to impaired people, there is many stairs to access the main attractions like the boats and the submarines. I spent three and half hours here. And I think that will be more exhibitions because when I visited in the basement was parked an air fighter (maybe a SU-32) and an Helicopter (looks like some modern Russian model), both were covered by tarpaulin.

they call it a Naval/Military Museum but unfortunately it's just a graveyard for old hardware (ships, submarine and planes) could be so much better if it was actually maintained - the history will just rust away; eventually

It was quite an interesting place to visit.  Its especially cool when anybody can climb onto some of the tanks there.  Also, the submarine tour was awesome.  Its sad to see trash in the engine inlet of the mig15, and 21s, but overall it was wrll worth it.
A little inconvenience for tourists is that working day closes at 17:00 and ticket window closes at 16:00. So early closing.

reviews.text: Amazing large room for an amazing price. Staff excellent and we were allowed a late checkout without any issues. We had  the dim sum special at the 5 Senses restaurant and for 350 yuan there was enough food for 6. We were only 2. Wow..

My stay at The Westin Qingdao was absolutely delightful! The hotel's ambiance and service exceeded expectations. The highlight, however, was the breakfast experience. The extensive buffet offered a delectable array of dishes, catering to various tastes and dietary preferences. From fresh fruits to hot and savory options, the breakfast spread was not only delicious but also presented with attention to detail. The serene atmosphere of the breakfast area, coupled with the attentive staff, made each morning a pleasant and energizing start to the day. A definite standout feature that added to the overall excellence of my stay at The Westin Qingdao.

Being a frequent traveler, I must give a 5-star to this beautiful hotel for its overall exceptional quality and facility. Front desk staff were very courteous and respectful. Upon request, they upgraded us to a suite for our membership status. The cleaning lady was super attentive and took care of all our needs during the entire stay. The location is excellent which is close to many famous places and subway stations. Love the hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Excellent location with metro just at the entrance.  One of the largest shopping mall in town is just 5 minutes walk.  The service is excellent and staff are very responsive with good attitude.  The breakfast has good choice of food.  The hotel is in general well maintained but there are some details that need to be improved, such as the windows are not clean, the bath tub has rusted edge and unclean pot for boiling water, etc.  Don't order the fried beef rice noodle, it has only 3 small pieces of beef which is far below normal standards of 8 pieces or 150gm of beef.

Very nice hotel. Stayed on the 54th floor with beautiful city view. Room and bathroom are spacious and well equipped. Enjoyed breakfast. Nice fitness and swimming pool (25 meters long). Opposite of MixC Mall, one of the largest malls in whole China. Not far from May 4th Square and Beijing Olympics Sailing Center. Will definitely consider staying again.

data.name: Stone Man

reviews.text: I was where on November 2015. It was very interesting traveling. If it will possible I will back to China..
Great place to see sunrise

(English comment as well)Stone Man. It is a lonely eroded stone in the sea offshore, shaped like an old man who has gone through many hardships. Shilaoren can refer to an area in Qingdao. It is believed that the name comes from Shilaoren Stone. For tourists, it may be misleading to go to Stone Man. Shilaoren Beach and Shilaoren Tourist Park are not the ideal places to appreciate Shilaoren. How to get there: Take the bus and get off at the Shilaoren Station on Hong Kong East Road, turn back, turn into the branch road, and walk towards the seaside; when you arrive at the parking lot, go in, go to the seaside, and see the Shilaoren. On that day, fishing boats docked at the seaside, and Old Man Shi added a bit of the atmosphere of an old fishing village. The sea breeze blows softly. Tourists around me always feel that they are keeping their voices down and the atmosphere is peaceful. Old Man Shi is always alone. The small beach next to it is more lively, but also very quiet and isolated, and the noise disappears with the sea breeze. The sunset in the west is beautiful, and the people of Shilaoren are enjoying the softest time of the day.
Reluctantly, before darkness, I left at the most beautiful moment of sunset.
Stone Man is an offshore lonely eroded elderly-like stone. It can be referred to an area. Tourists could get confused when looking for Stone Men. Neither Stone Man beach nor Stone Man sightseeing garden is an ideal location for viewing. Aceess way: take a bus, get off at Stone Man stop of Hong Kong East road. Walk back, turn to side road going to seaside. Enter when arriving at a carpark and go to seaside. That's Stone Man. That day, fishing vessels anchored, scenting old days fishing village vibe. Stone Man was always lonely. Gentle breeze, gentle tourists and humble voices in a hormony. The small beach nearby was more crowded, but identically hormonic. Whispers and laugher were dissolved in air with breeze, fading into silence. Sunset in the west was beautiful. People in Stone Man were worshiping the most gentle time in a day.
Lingered and lingered, l left at the most beautiful moment of sunset before darkness.
A small stone island can be seen far from the beach. Due to bad weather, swimming in the beach was prohibited, so we could only see rocks from afar.

Golf courses and sea view, not recommended in bad weather conditions

reviews.text: It's surprisingly big and there are a ton of people. Each alley is specialized in unique foods and sells everything from food to dogs and cats. In the alleys, food is mainly sold, and on the roadside, clothes and fruits are sold. There are many types of fruits, including durian, tropical fruits, and strawberries. Everything from stinky tofu to fish is fried in oil and sold, and accessories are also available. It is said to be crowded with people on weekends. Be sure to visit in the evening. Commercial pedestrian streets in Shandong are all called "Golden Streets", and the Taitung Night Market in Qingdao is no exception.
Perhaps in an attempt to attract tourists, the exterior walls of the buildings on both sides of Golden Street are painted with distinctive paintings.
The pedestrian street is very wide, and the shops are mainly restaurants and clothing stores, but there are not many tourists and it is a bit deserted.
There are some small stalls at the other end of Golden Street, which are like Hong Kong's Ladies' Street, but there are too many passers-by and the business is slow.
Although it is a small stall, it sells factory goods "Made in China". In other words, it is just a physical version of Taobao, which is not attractive at all.
Golden Street is not very long. If you are not shopping, you can finish it in less than 30 minutes.

The twist is delicious. The yogurt is delicious, but the expensive crepes are not good. The potatoes are delicious, but covered in spices. The taro pie is not very good either. That rice cake cake is the worst. Haha.

I wanted to visit on Sunday, September 10, 2023, but due to safety inspection, the night market was not open.
No visit possible....
Be sure to check whether there is a night market or not...
There are a lot of snacks, and it smells like fireworks. I really like this kind of snack gathering place. The city should really leave a space for such a night market.

reviews.text: Flowers for four seasons are ready for visitors!! It’s a huge park for taking great pictures! I spend 2 hours but can’t even finish 1/4 of the Park, it contains botanical garden, rock garden...etc. Definitely worth a full afternoon!!

Badaguan (Chinese: 八大关; pinyin: Bā Dà Guān ; lit. 'the eight great passes') is a historical mansion area located near the coastline in the city of Qingdao, Shandong, China.

Badaguan is made up of streets named after great military forts of the ancient times. It was originally a residential area for the Germans built when Qingdao was a German protectorate (1897–1914). Each street is lined with a single species of tree and many street names are colloquially known by the trees that line them.[1] Along the streets are houses built in a variety of European architectural styles. Badaguan is bordered on the west by No. 1 Beach and on the east by No. 3 Beach. Badaguan is a popular destination for wedding photography. One can often see dozens of newlywed-couples being photographed along Badaguan's shoreline and greenspace.
Historical district with a lot of parks and old buildings, THE local spot for photo shots. We have encountered no less than 40 couples taking their wedding gown pictures here.
A nice area to walk around and enjoy the greenery and european style architecture. It's also near the beach (no. 2 bathing scenic area).
Interesting old homes in European styles, but there is an admission fee for each house and one needs to do a bit of walking.

reviews.text:
1. Entrance fee: RMB20
2. You can only find tickets at ticket sales, but you cannot purchase them.
3. Purchase tickets directly through QR code.
4. Foreigners without a Chinese phone number can purchase tickets only with the help of public security (police).
-> There is no waiting line to buy tickets, but it takes 20 minutes just to buy tickets because you have to find someone (public security) to help you.
5. Korean Explanation Audio Rental: RMB20
- When renting, you must leave something that can represent your identity, such as your passport.
6. Dirty toilet
-Be sure to check out other places before visiting.

A well-preserved century-old monument, the former site of the German Governor's Building. The furniture and decorations in the house remain in their original state, but it is a pity that they cannot be photographed. The whole building has a unique style.

A space where you can see the luxury of the German Governor-General
There is a hole at the top where the German governor could hide and spy on visitors to determine whether they were worth meeting or not, so be sure to look for it!
It is a place that became famous among Chinese people due to Mao Zedong's visit.

Qingdao is a place full of German flavor. The tradition of beer made by German soldiers in the past continued and became ‘Tsingtao’ beer. The pier that the Germans built for ships to wait has become the most famous photo spot, ‘Wharf.’ The place where the German military installed a wireless base station became ‘Signal Mountain.’ There is also a village full of German-style houses. There is no end to seeing all these places. If I had to choose just one place where I could feel Germany during my limited time, it would be the guest house. This guesthouse is where the German governor stayed a long time ago. It is a place where you can truly feel the dignity and power of those in power who ruled the area. The exterior of the building is sturdy and majestic, like a small castle. The inside is definitely worth checking out. When you open the door and enter, the miniature guesthouse appears as if seen from a drone. The red carpet also feels classy. There are quite a few rooms, and each room has a different function. The interior items in each room, including the study, bedroom, drawing room, bathroom, and servant's room, remain intact, making it enough to imagine those times. The indoor garden is also great. If you think, “There’s nothing special about just looking at a building,” you’re mistaken. It takes quite some time to appreciate it carefully. Take your time and look carefully. The more time you spend, the more fun you have. It's worth the price of admission, but it's too bad you can't take pictures inside.

Personally, I was a little disappointed. I was disappointed by the restrictions on admission fees, facilities, and even the underground concession stand in such a hot weather, but even though the guest house is a place with historical significance, I think it is a bit harsh to restrict even going out to the terrace from indoors.

reviews.text: The dumplings at qingdao were recommended to me by a friend. The meat was flavorful, but I found that the wrappers were a little thick and solid (they were warm, but not hot when I ate them, so that may be a part of it). The wonton soup broth was verrryyy light. This would be great if you are not feeling too well or don’t want something very strong.

The food was good, but the duck sauce, and mustard packets they gave me were very old. Neither one tasted like they were supposed to. The duck sauce came out like thick glue, and the mustard had turned brown, which is not the right color for Chinese mustard. They need to restock with fresh condiment packets. Otherwise everything was good.

my family comes here a lot for the authentic northern Chinese dishes. My favorites are the pork and shrimp dumplings (Soo plump, juicy and flavorful) and spicy fish! They all taste home cooked and are the perfect answer to northern Chinese food cravings.

Love, love, love! Wen (the owner) and his family and crew have been feeding us good home cooked meals for years. I love both their authentic Chinese food and American Chinese. Great vegetarian options and brown rice, there is something to please everyone. During their renovation, which took infinitely longer than expected, Wen paid his staff. Having done something similar for my own business, I have utmost respect for him. Now about food: My mother's family is originally from northern Korea so a lot of their food is what I ate growing up in S Korea. My mother in law, who grew up in CT loves their general Gao's chicken. My husband who loves all things spicy gets shredded beef with hot peppers and cucumber salad . My 3 y o daughter gets white rice 'the best rice ever!'. My 18 months old son devours the entire order of chicken dumplings. I have been hooked to pork tripes and cold beef dish combined. If you love food, like we do, this is a must try. Ask what they have fresh that day.

Wonderful little restaurant in the North of Cambridge! The big draw here is the handmade dumplings (most other places utilise machines) but here everything is made by a lovely lady. I strongly recommend the pork dumplings and also the basil chicken!

data.formatted_address: China, Shan Dong Sheng, Qing Dao Shi, Shi Nan Qu, 太平路19号 邮政编码: 266005
data.name: Temple of the Queen of Heaven

reviews.text: Its good   . Temple is a temple . Think Lama is better .
Nice view from here.

Qingdao Tianhou Palace (Qingdao Folklore Museum) is located at No. 19 Taiping Road, Shinan District, Qingdao City, Shandong Province, China. It was founded in the third year of Chenghua in the Ming Dynasty (1467). The existing building complex is a brick and wood structure of the Ming and Qing Dynasties. It is the oldest existing building in Qingdao urban area. The earliest and only ancient building preserved to this day.

Before the construction of Qingdao, the Qianhai area where Tianhou Palace is located was originally a place where fishermen used to dry their nets for fishing. At that time, larger villages Qingdao Village and Huiqian Village appeared. Tianhou Palace was Qingdao Village (its name comes from the sea It is part of the island (Little Qingdao), and the nearby residents are mainly fishermen, boatmen and businessmen. In the mid-Ming Dynasty, the maritime shipping industry at the nearby Qingdao Port of the fishing boat wharf (today's Zhanqiao Sea) gradually opened up. With the development of trade with Jiangsu, Zhejiang, Fujian and Guangdong, the Tianhou belief in Fujian also spread to Qingdao. Three Tianhou Palaces were built in Qingdao, but the other two in Shazikou and Cangkou no longer exist.

The Tianhou Palace located at the entrance of Qingdao was called Tianfei Palace when it was first built. Local people called it the "Chinese Temple". It was a place where local fishermen and merchants worshiped the "Mother of Heaven" and prayed for shipping and safe life. The Quanzhen Suishan sect of Taoism, whose presiding Taoist belonged to the same sect as the Taiqing Palace in Laoshan in the 1920s. The early building only consisted of three main halls, the Notre Dame Hall, and two auxiliary halls, the Dragon King's Mansion and the Ducai Mansion. After seven repairs and expansions in the Ming, Qing, and Republic of China, it reached its current scale (including the 11th year of Yongzheng in the Qing Dynasty and the 24th year of Guangxu). The scale of the renovation and expansion was relatively large). There are two stone tablets from the Tongzhi period of the Qing Dynasty in the gate of Tianhou Palace. They are the "Stele of Recruitment to Build a Theater" in the fourth year of Tongzhi (1865) and the "Stele of Recruitment to Build a Theater" in the thirteenth year of Tongzhi (1874). "Temple Reconstruction Stele" records the reconstruction of Tianhou Temple at that time, and is also an important source of information for understanding the history of Qingdao.

Since the reconstruction of the theater building in the fourth year of Tongzhi (1865), Tianhou Palace has gradually become a cultural and entertainment place for residents of Qingdaokou. In the "Records of Haiyuntang" written by Hu Cunyue, a Qingdao villager, Tianhou Palace was mentioned many times during the Guangxu period. The temple fair was held at that time. At that time, merchants in the nearby area would go to Thean Hou Temple to offer incense and worship on the first, fifteenth and fifteenth day of the first lunar month every year. At this time, the incense in the temple was the most prosperous, and a stage was set up for singing and opera, which attracted a large number of people from the surrounding area. villagers. In addition, during the first lunar month, Thean Hou Temple also holds a large number of folk arts and folk acrobatic performances.

In 1897, the German Empire built Qingdao. The Qianhai area from Qingdao Railway Station to Huiquan was designated as Qingdao District in the new urban planning. Large areas of the original villages were demolished, and Tianhou Palace was also included in the demolition plan. However, It was abandoned due to strong opposition from the public. Later, the Government-General planned to move the Thean Hau Palace to the Baodao District where the Chinese lived, but it was not implemented due to the change of government between Germany and Japan.

After 1949, Qingdao Tianhou Palace was managed and used by cultural and museum units, and was used to organize cultural relics exhibitions many times. During the Cultural Revolution, it was occupied by Shinan's "Wen Gong Wu Wei". The double-story cornices of the theater were sawn off, and its glazed and gray tiles were replaced with cement tiles. The bell tower, drum tower and the statues in the hall were also damaged. It was restored and opened in December 1998 and turned into the Qingdao Folklore Museum. It has become a cultural landscape integrating Tianhou culture, marine culture and folk culture.

The building faces south and is divided into two courtyards. The layout adopts the Chinese classical axis type, including the main hall, east and west side halls, left and right wing rooms, grand theater tower, bell and drum tower and ancillary buildings. There are a total of 16 palaces with more than 80 rooms. Except for the theater building, which is covered with glazed tiles, the other buildings all use plain walls, small gray tiles, and are dotted with Su-style colorful paintings. Among the existing ancient buildings in Qingdao, its architectural art and colorful painting art are second to none.

The grand theater building faces Taiping Road. It is a two-story pavilion with three rooms in width. It has double eaves on the top of the mountain and a gate below. The plaque has the four characters "Ci Yun Pu Quilt" written on it. It was placed by Ding Jingchen, a salt merchant from the Chamber of Commerce in 1940. There is a There is a large flagpole and a pair of stone lions. There was originally a granite stone plaque "Thean Hou Temple" hanging on the second floor. There are reliefs of two dragons playing with beads on the left, right and top. The lower part has wavy eaves, which means there should be no "play" when entering. Eaves (joking)". On both sides of the theater building are the bell tower, the drum tower and the east and west wing rooms. There are two large osmanthus trees planted in the courtyard. They are called "cinnabar osmanthus" because the flowers are red. Every time around the Mid-Autumn Festival, the courtyard is filled with the fragrance of osmanthus flowers, attracting a large number of tourists. Come and watch. Enter the second courtyard through the mountain gate. There are two large ginkgo trees in the courtyard, a male and a female. It is said that they were planted when the main hall was rebuilt in the 11th year of Yongzheng reign of the Qing Dynasty (1733). Behind it is the main hall dedicated to the Queen of Heaven. It is three rooms wide and has a single eaves on the top of the mountain. There is a plaque "Shen Zhao Hai Biao" written by Emperor Yongzheng (the original plaque has been lost, and the current plaque is copied from the Mazu Temple in Meizhou, Fujian). The Mazu statue is carved from a whole piece of camphor wood and is 2.8 meters high. There are clairvoyant eyes and shunfeng ears on both sides. The east and west auxiliary halls are the Dragon King's Mansion and the Ducai Mansion, and the wings on both sides are used for related exhibitions of the Folk Museum, which includes Queen of Heaven culture, folk handicrafts, folk customs, etc.
Saw it while passing by. Quite a classic building.
Very beautiful, wonderful territory of the park, a feeling of touching the history of a wonderful country.

reviews.text:
Qingdao TV Tower is a 232 metres (761 ft) tall lattice television tower with an observation deck situated on the top of 116 metres high Taiping Hill in Julin Hill Park in Qingdao, China. It is the tallest attraction in the city.

Qingdao TV tower

Construction on the Qingdao TV Tower began in 1993 and was completed in 1996. Architect Renle Ma is known for other tower structures such as the Zhongyuan Tower and the Henan Tower (FU Tower). The steel tower weighs 2000 tons and is home to 11 broadcasting facilities.

The tower has a restaurant in a ball-shaped cabinet 130 metres above the ground; under this ball, there is a cylindric cabinet containing a 230 square metres sightseeing platform. In the basement of the tower, there is an Olympic museum, as the 2008 Summer Olympics sailing events took place at Qingdao.
👏👏👏👏👍
Nice view when the weather is good. Entrance fee is quite expensive (100 RMB)
Qingdao

You can go to the tower overlooking Qingdao city by taxi or lift, but it is quite in the mountains. It was difficult to catch a taxi on the way home. There is a cafe on the observation deck where you can relax.

data.name: Former Residence of Kang Youwei

reviews.text: Kang Youwei stands as one of the pivotal figures in Chinese modern history, advocating for the transformation of China into a modern nation. Spending significant time abroad and residing in Shanghai, he ultimately chose Qingdao as his final dwelling place. Through exploring the exhibitions housed within the three-story building, visitors can gain insight into Kang Youwei's life and influence, as well as a brief history of modern Qingdao. From its humble origins as a nameless fishing village to its evolution into a picturesque international coastal city, Qingdao's journey mirrors the ambitions and changes of Kang Youwei's era. and it’s free, you can make a reservation at WeChat or something
It's slightly interesting though I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to see it.

The appearance of Kang Youwei's former residence is very inconspicuous. It is located at the foot of Xiaoyu Mountain, facing Huiquan Bay, with the mountain behind it and the sea facing it. It has a very good Feng Shui.
There is a large stone staircase at the entrance, which is very impressive.
Kang Youwei's former residence combines German and Chinese architectural styles, which is very special. Is this the architectural style of the late Qing Dynasty?
Although the place is not large, the buildings are generally well preserved, and there are many cultural relics of Kang Youwei, which are worth visiting.
The former rooms are now used as exhibition halls. The first is the "Kang Youwei Life and Historical Relics Exhibition", which introduces various aspects of Kang Youwei's life.
In addition to the exhibition hall, some rooms have been restored to the conditions when Kang Youwei lived, including the living room, study room and bedroom.
Most of the furniture on display here were donated by Pu Wei, Prince Gongxian of the late Qing Dynasty, and are considered historical relics.
Another exhibition hall is an exhibition of Kang Youwei's calligraphy. During his stay here, Kang Youwei met with cultural celebrities many times and devoted himself to the study of calligraphy.
The last exhibition hall is called "Kang Youwei's Road to the World"...what is it about?
Only now did the thick-browed boy know that Kang Youwei once traveled around the world, not only in Europe and the United States, but also in Egypt and South America. He left behind many articles and poems he wrote while traveling around the world. It can be said that Kang Youwei was the first person in Chinese history to A travel expert.
In addition to Kang Youwei's manuscripts, this exhibition hall also displays some handicrafts that Kang Youwei bought from abroad, which is very special.
There is also a not-so-pretty garden next to the former residence. Here is a ginkgo tree planted by Kang Youwei when he was still alive. It has now become a towering tree.

Qingdao Kang Youwei's former residence is located at No. 5, Fushan Branch Road, Shinan District, Qingdao City, Shandong Province, China. The building has both German and Chinese styles. Founded in 1899
The former residence of historical figures can make you dream about the people and things here a hundred years ago.

reviews.text: Beautifull natural scenic area, view over the sea and the walk woukf be hard to climb on the top without cable car... One of the best thing to see at Qingdao
Beautiful mountain and seaview

Laoshan has a southern route and a northern Jiushui tourist route. The Southern Line Pass covers Jufeng, Taiqing, Yangkou and Huayan tourist areas and is valid for two days. Yangkou and Huayan are both in the northeast of Mount Laoshan. Generally, Yangkou and Huayan Scenic Spots are visited together. There are sightseeing buses between Yangkou and Huayan.
The majesty of the giant peaks, the delicate and changeable postures, and the clarity and profundity of Huayan, each is good at winning. Looking up, the mountain is four hundred meters high. Set up a ropeway. You can hike up and down the mountain in half a day. The Yangkou Tourist Route should be the easier and more convenient among the Laoshan South Routes. The scenic spots along the way are compact and varied. Follow the trail up the mountain to the Taiping Palace on the mountainside. It is similar to the Taoist temples of Taiqing Palace and Shangqing Palace in Taiqing Dynasty, with ancient trees; the footprints and stories of famous Taoist priests such as Liu Ruozhuo and Qiu Chuji are also spread here. There are Sheep Rock and Lion Peak nearby. Lion Peak is a small peak made of stacked rocks. There are trails to reach the top. There are two good places to view the mountains, the sea and the rocks, the Tianyuan on the top of the mountain and the Lion Peak. After descending from Lion Peak, you can go to Youlong Cave, pass the Hunyuan Stone with a star map engraved on it, and walk up the path to reach Shouzi Peak. The peak wall is engraved with the word "Shou", the largest one is a Shou in regular script, which is 20 meters high and 16 meters wide. All made in 1993. Then go to the cableway mountain station, then go to Mitian Cave, and go through the cave to the top of the mountain. Tourists filed into the cave, which was dark and humid; they lined up and slowly climbed up the narrow steps. The path slowly turned around among the boulders and climbed up to the height of a building. Coming out of the cave, you suddenly see the light, giving you a dramatic effect of seeing Mount Laoshan again. Go forward and climb a single step to reach the top of the mountain. From a high position, the Yangkou Bathing Beach and the surrounding houses are as flat as the palm of your hand, the Yellow Sea is vast, and the water and the sky meet; resting in the shade of a huge stone, the breeze blows, the sun shines high, the sky and the earth are gorgeous and cool. There is nothing better than this feeling of happiness. Coming down from Tianyuan, go down the mountain road next to Five Fingers Stone.
There are many stone carvings on Yangkou, which can be found in Ming, Qing and the Republic of China. The content is mostly travel lyricism, but there are exceptions. Among them, the climbing day of the Lion Peak in the year of Ding Chou "forever solidifying the rivers and mountains"; Beside the Sheep Stone, there are seven words of reasoning written by Ke Jia in the year of Xinxi (1981): "Gold is pure... right and wrong are not allowed..." which expresses tolerance for others. , stick to things. An alternative experience other than traveling.

Qingdao No.1 International School is truly exceptional. From the moment I stepped onto the campus, I was impressed by the warm and welcoming atmosphere. The dedicated staff and teachers go above and beyond to provide a high level education, ensuring that students not only excel academically, but also develop crucial life skills and values. While nothing is perfect, QISS is the exception.

With smaller class sizes, a wonderful learning environment, and teachers who care, I feel comfortable and at ease learning in the community of QISS. It's an inspiring school that sparks "Leader in Me" for students at all times of the day, a wonderful place where everyone can enjoy the creative project-based learning environment, and a lovely home with engaging, lively, and energetic faculty and peers. It is definitely worth 5 stars as an excellent international school.

The school lunch is very delicious, we have various kinds of dishes in our cafeteria, and it costs cheap. We have everything that we need in our school, a tennis court, basketball court, volleyball court, and a huge soccer field.

This is my 5th year working here and I love being a part of the team culture. I also have 2 children attending QISS and as a parent I value the nurturing and supportive environment QISS and staff at QISS provide for them. The program truly encompasses holistic development and focuses on student wellbeing and belonging. Being a small community school means my children get 1:1 time with their teachers and the teachers truly go above and beyond for every student in their class.
